preloaded/cstenten23_mj2:
# CZECH CORPUS CQL GUIDE

## GENERAL CONTEXT
Czech language corpus (also used for Slovak corpora with Majka morphological analyzer)

**Available attributes:**
- word, lc (lowercase word)
- tag (POS tag)
- lemma, lemma_lc (lowercase lemma)
- lempos, lempos_lc (lemma+suffix, lowercase)
- gender_lemma, gender_lemma_lc (gender lemma, lowercase)
- k, g, n, c, p, m, pos (individual tag components)

**Structures:**
- doc attributes: url, title, wiki_categories, urldomain, website, crawl_date, modified_date, wiki_translations, modified_month, tld, modified_year, topic, domain_distance, genre, src, crawl_year
- p (paragraph) with heading attribute
- s (sentence), g (grouping)

**Lempos suffixes:** nouns=-n, adjectives=-j, pronouns=-d, numerals=-m, verbs=-v, adverbs=-a, prepositions=-p, conjunctions=-c

**Word sketch relations available:** subjects, objects (accusative/dative/genitive/infinitive/instrumental/locale), modifiers, prepositional phrases, passive constructions, before/after patterns, and many others

## HOW TO WRITE CQL WITH THIS TAGSET

**Tag format is STRICT and must follow canonical attribute order: kegncpamdxytzw~**

- Tags start with 2-character POS code (k1, k2, k5, etc.)
- Each attribute = lowercase letter (g=gender, n=number, c=case, e=negation, etc.)
- Each value = uppercase letter (F=feminine, P=plural, N=negation, etc.)
- Format: [tag="k# + attribute-value pairs in canonical order"]
- Use straight double quotation marks only
- Wildcard .* fills undefined positions

**Examples:**
- Plural nouns: [tag="k1.*nP.*"]
- Feminine singular adjectives, instrumental case: [tag="k2.*gFnSc7.*"]
- WRONG order: [tag="k2.*nSgFc7.*"] (number before gender violates canonical order)
- Masculine nouns (both animate/inanimate): [tag="k1g(M|I).*"]

## THE TAGSET

**Tag must have format: k + e + g + n + c + p + a + m + d + x + y + t + z + w (canonical order is strict)**

**k = Part of speech (2 characters, tag starts with this):**
- k1 = noun
- k2 = adjective
- k3 = pronoun
- k4 = numeral
- k5 = verb
- k6 = adverb
- k7 = preposition
- k8 = conjunction
- k9 = particle
- k0 = interjection
- kA = abbreviation
- kI = punctuation

**e = Negation (adjectives, verbs, adverbs only):**
- eA = affirmation
- eN = negation

**g = Gender (nouns, adjectives, pronouns, numerals):**
- gM = animate masculine
- gI = inanimate masculine
- gN = neuter
- gF = feminine
- gR = family name/surname

**n = Number (nouns, adjectives, pronouns, numerals):**
- nS = singular
- nP = plural

**c = Case (nouns, adjectives, pronouns, numerals, prepositions):**
- c1 = nominative
- c2 = genitive
- c3 = dative
- c4 = accusative
- c5 = vocative
- c6 = locative
- c7 = instrumental

**p = Person (pronouns, verbs):**
- p1 = first person
- p2 = second person
- p3 = third person

**a = Aspect (verbs only):**
- aP = perfect
- aI = imperfect
- aB = biaspectual

**m = Verb type (verbs only):**
- mF = infinitive
- mI = present indicative
- mR = imperative
- mA = past participle (active)
- mN = passive participle (n/t-participle)
- mS = present transgressive
- mD = past transgressive
- mB = future indicative

**d = Degree (adjectives, adverbs):**
- d1 = positive
- d2 = comparative
- d3 = superlative

**x = Type (various word classes):**
- Nouns: xP = special paradigm (půl, čtvrt)
- Pronouns: xP=personal, xO=possessive, xD=demonstrative, xT=delimitative
- Numerals: xC=cardinal, xO=ordinal, xR=reproductive
- Adverbs: xD=demonstrative, xT=delimitative
- Conjunctions: xC=coordinate, xS=subordinate
- Punctuation: x.=.?!, x,=,:;, x"=quotes, x(=opening brackets, x)=closing brackets, x~=other symbols

**y = Additional type (pronouns, numerals, adverbs):**
- Pronouns: yF=reflexive, yQ=interrogative, yR=relative, yN=negative, yI=indeterminate
- Numerals: yN=negative, yI=indeterminate
- Adverbs: yQ=interrogative, yR=relative, yN=negative, yI=indeterminate

**t = Adverb semantic type (adverbs only):**
- tS = status
- tD = modal
- tT = time
- tA = respect
- tC = reason
- tL = place
- tM = manner
- tQ = extent

**w = Stylistic flag (all major word classes):**
- wA = archaic
- wB = poetic
- wC = only in corpora
- wE = expressive
- wH = conversational
- wK = bookish
- wN = dialectal
- wO = regional
- wR = rare
- wZ = obsolete

# English Corpus Description for CQL Queries ## General Context English corpus annotated with TreeTagger POS tagger (Sketch Engine pipeline version 3). Based on Penn Treebank tagset with modifications: distinguishes be (VB*) and have (VH*) from other verbs (VV*); uses NP/NPS for proper nouns; possessive clitic re-tokenized and joined to preceding word; contains special tags for possessives (Z, *Z suffixes). ## How CQL with Tagset Should Be Written **Tag format is STRICT** - must use exact uppercase format from tagset: `[tag="NNS"]` **Token-level attributes:** - `word` - word form - `tag` - POS tag (strict format required) - `lemma` - base form - `pos` - part of speech - `lempos` - lemma with POS suffix (e.g., "take-v", "green-j") - `lc`, `lemma_lc`, `lempos_lc` - lowercase variants **Structures:** - `` - sentence - `

` - paragraph (attribute: `heading`) - `` - g-unit - `` - document (attributes: `url`, `title`, `wiki_categories`, `urldomain`, `website`, `crawl_date`, `modified_date`, `tld`, `wiki_translations`, `modified_month`, `modified_year`, `topic`, `tld_expl`, `domain_distance`, `genre`, `src`, `crawl_year`) **Lempos suffixes:** - `-j` adjective - `-a` adverb - `-c` conjunction - `-n` noun - `-m` numeral - `-i` preposition - `-d` pronoun - `-v` verb **Annotation shortcuts (regex patterns):** - adjective: `J.*` - adverb: `RB.?` - conjunction: `CC` - determiner: `DT` - noun: `N.*` - numeral: `CD` - particle: `RP` - preposition: `IN` - pronoun: `PP.?` - verb: `V.*` ## The Tagset **Tag format must be exact uppercase (strict).** **(empty)** - HTML/entities in angle brackets **"** or **"** - single/double quotation marks (" ') **(** - left brackets ( [ { **)** - right brackets ) ] } **,** - comma **$** - currency symbols ($ £ €) **#** - hash sign **:** - dashes, ellipsis, underscore, (semi)colon (- … .. _ ; :) **CC** - coordinating conjunction (and, but, or) **CD** - cardinal number (1, one, two) **CDZ** - possessive numeral (one's) **DT** - determiner (the, a, an, this) **EX** - existential there (there is) **FW** - foreign word (d'hoevre) **IN** - preposition/subordinating conjunction (in, of, like) **IN/that** - subordinator "that" **JJ** - adjective (green, big) **JJR** - comparative adjective (greener, bigger) **JJS** - superlative adjective (greenest, biggest) **LS** - list marker (1)) **MD** - modal verb (could, will, should, would, can, must) **NN** - singular/mass noun (table, water) **NNS** - plural noun (tables, people) **NNSZ** - possessive plural noun (people's, women's) **NNZ** - possessive singular/mass noun (year's, world's) **NP** - singular proper noun (John, London) **NPS** - plural proper noun (Vikings, Americans) **NPSZ** - possessive plural proper noun (Boys', Workers') **NPZ** - possessive singular proper noun (Britain's, God's) **PDT** - predeterminer (both, all) **PP** - personal pronoun (I, he, it, you) **PPZ** - possessive pronoun (my, his, your) **RB** - adverb (however, usually, naturally, here) **RBR** - comparative adverb (better, faster) **RBS** - superlative adverb (best, fastest) **RP** - particle (up in "give up") **SENT** - sentence-break punctuation (. ! ?) **SYM** - symbols (/ = *) **TO** - infinitive marker "to" **UH** - interjection (uh, oh, wow) **VB** - be base form (be) **VBD** - be past tense (was, were) **VBG** - be gerund/present participle (being) **VBN** - be past participle (been) **VBP** - be present non-3rd person (am, are) **VBZ** - be 3rd person singular present (is) **VH** - have base form (have) **VHD** - have past tense (had) **VHG** - have gerund/present participle (having) **VHN** - have past participle (had) **VHP** - have present non-3rd person (have) **VHZ** - have 3rd person singular present (has) **VV** - verb base form (take, go, run) **VVD** - verb past tense (took, went, ran) **VVG** - verb gerund/present participle (taking, going, running) **VVN** - verb past participle (taken, gone, run) **VVP** - verb present non-3rd person (take, go, run) **VVZ** - verb 3rd person singular present (takes, goes, runs) **WDT** - wh-determiner (which, what) **WP** - wh-pronoun (who, what, whom) **WPZ** - possessive wh-pronoun (whose) **WRB** - wh-adverb (where, when, why, how) **Z** - possessive ending ('s) **Word sketch relations available** (for grammatical collocations): subjects/objects of verbs, modifiers of nouns, adjectives/adverbs modified by adverbs, phrasal verb patterns (with particles: up, down, out, etc.), possessors, complements, prepositional phrases, passive constructions, infinitive/gerund objects, predicates, and various other grammatical dependencies.
preloaded/europarl7_cs:
# Czech Corpus CQL Guide

## General Context
- **Language**: Czech (also used for Slovak corpora with Majka morphological analyzer)
- **Tagset type**: Attributive tagset with strict attribute-value pairs
- **Word sketch relations**: Available for grammatical dependency queries (subjects, objects, modifiers, prepositional phrases, etc.)

## How to Write CQL with This Tagset

**Tag format is STRICT** and must follow the canonical order: **kegncpamdxytzw~**

- Start with POS identifier: k + single character (k1, k2, k5, etc.)
- Each attribute = single lowercase letter (g, n, c, p, etc.)
- Each value = single uppercase letter or digit (F, P, 7, etc.)
- Order matters: gender (g) BEFORE number (n) BEFORE case (c), etc.
- Example: `[tag="k2.*gFnSc7.*"]` finds feminine singular adjectives in instrumental case
- WRONG: `[tag="k2.*nSgFc7.*"]` (number before gender violates order)
- Use `.*` for wildcards
- Use straight double quotation marks only
- Combine alternatives with | in parentheses: `[tag="k1g(M|I).*"]` for all masculine nouns

**Available attributes**:
- word, tag, lempos, lemma, lemma_lc, lc, gender_lemma, k, g, n, c, p, m

**Lempos suffixes** (append to lemma):
- -n (noun), -j (adjective), -d (pronoun), -m (numeral), -v (verb), -a (adverb), -p (preposition), -c (conjunction), -i (interjection)

**Structures**: g, s (id), p (id), speaker (name, id, language), document (id, wordcount), chapter (id)

## The Tagset

**k (part of speech)** – first 2 characters of every tag:
- k1 = noun | k2 = adjective | k3 = pronoun | k4 = numeral | k5 = verb | k6 = adverb | k7 = preposition | k8 = conjunction | k9 = particle | k0 = interjection | kA = abbreviation | kI = punctuation

**e (negation)** – for adjectives, verbs, adverbs:
- eA = affirmative | eN = negative

**g (gender)** – for nouns, adjectives, pronouns, numerals:
- gM = animate masculine | gI = inanimate masculine | gN = neuter | gF = feminine | gR = family name/surname

**n (number)** – for nouns, adjectives, pronouns, numerals:
- nS = singular | nP = plural

**c (case)** – for nouns, adjectives, pronouns, numerals, prepositions:
- c1 = nominative | c2 = genitive | c3 = dative | c4 = accusative | c5 = vocative | c6 = locative | c7 = instrumental

**p (person)** – for pronouns, verbs:
- p1 = first person | p2 = second person | p3 = third person

**a (aspect)** – for verbs only:
- aP = perfect | aI = imperfect | aB = biaspectual

**m (verb type)** – for verbs only:
- mF = infinitive | mI = present indicative | mR = imperative | mA = past participle (active) | mN = passive participle (n/t-participle) | mS = present transgressive | mD = past transgressive | mB = future indicative

**d (degree)** – for adjectives, adverbs:
- d1 = positive | d2 = comparative | d3 = superlative

**x (subtype)** – varies by POS:
- *Noun*: xP = special paradigm (půl, čtvrt)
- *Pronoun*: xP = personal | xO = possessive | xD = demonstrative | xT = delimitative
- *Numeral*: xC = cardinal | xO = ordinal | xR = reproductive
- *Adverb*: xD = demonstrative | xT = delimitative
- *Conjunction*: xC = coordinate | xS = subordinate
- *Punctuation*: x. = .?! | x, = ,:; | x" = quotes | x( = opening brackets | x) = closing brackets | x~ = other symbols

**y (additional subtype)** – varies by POS:
- *Pronoun*: yF = reflexive | yQ = interrogative | yR = relative | yN = negative | yI = indeterminate
- *Numeral*: yN = negative | yI = indeterminate
- *Adverb*: yQ = interrogative | yR = relative | yN = negative | yI = indeterminate

**t (semantic type)** – for adverbs only:
- tS = status | tD = modal | tT = time | tA = respect | tC = reason | tL = place | tM = manner | tQ = extent

**w (stylistic flag)** – for nouns, adjectives, pronouns, numerals, verbs, adverbs, prepositions, conjunctions, particles:
- wA = archaism | wB = poeticism | wC = only in corpora | wE = expressive | wH = conversational | wK = bookish | wO = regional | wR = rare | wZ = obsolete | wN = dialectal

# Czech Corpus CQL Reference

## GENERAL CONTEXT

**Language:** Czech (also used for Slovak corpora with Majka morphological analyzer)

**Available attributes:**
- word, tag, lempos, gender_lemma, lemma, lc (word lowercase), lemma_lc, lempos_lc, k, g, n, c, p, m, pos

**Available structures:**
- g, s, p (with attribute "name"), speaker (with attribute "name" = Speaker's role and name), note (with attribute "type"), doc (with attributes: source_url, url_access_time, date, date_year_month, date_day, date_year, date_month, chamber)

**Corpus annotations (for quick reference):**
- noun: k1.*, adjective: k2.*, pronoun: k3.*, numeral: k4.*, verb: k5.*, adverb: k6.*, preposition: k7.*, conjunction: k8.*

**Lempos suffixes:**
- noun: -n, adjective: -j, pronoun: -d, numeral: -m, verb: -v, adverb: -a, preposition: -p, conjunction: -c

**Word sketch relations:**
- "%w" and/or ..., "%w" is ..., "%w" of ..., ... is "%w", ... of "%w", accusative/dative/genitive/infinitive/instrumental/locale objects of "%w", modified by "%w", modifiers of "%w", nouns after/before "%w", nouns modified by "%w", nouns or verbs after/before "%w", numbers before "%w", passive verbs with "%w" as subject, prepositional phrases, subjects of "%w", subjects of "be %w", subjects of passive "%w", verbs before "%w", verbs with "%w" as accusative/dative/genitive/infinitive/instrumental/locale object, verbs with "%w" as subject, words after/before "%w"

## HOW CQL WITH TAGSET SHOULD BE WRITTEN

**Tag format is STRICT and must follow this structure:**
- Tag = attribute-value pairs where attribute is single lowercase letter, value is single capital letter
- ALWAYS starts with 2-character part of speech code (e.g., k1, k2, k5)
- Canonical order is MANDATORY: **kegncpamdxytzw~**
- Example: g (gender) must precede n (number) which must precede c (case)
- Correct: `[tag="k2.*gFnSc7.*"]` (feminine singular adjective in instrumental)
- INCORRECT: `[tag="k2.*nSgFc7.*"]` (wrong order: number before gender)

**CQL syntax:**
- Use straight double quotation marks: `[tag="..."]`
- Wildcards allowed with .*
- Example: `[tag="k1.*nP.*"]` finds all plural nouns
- Example: `[tag="k1g(M|I).*"]` finds all masculine nouns (animate or inanimate)

## THE TAGSET

### Part of speech (k) - ALWAYS FIRST, 2 characters
k1 = noun, k2 = adjective, k3 = pronoun, k4 = numeral, k5 = verb, k6 = adverb, k7 = preposition, k8 = conjunction, k9 = particle, k0 = interjection, kA = abbreviation, kI = punctuation

### Negation (e) - for adjectives, verbs, adverbs
eA = affirmation, eN = negation

### Gender (g) - for nouns, adjectives, pronouns, numerals
gM = animate masculine, gI = inanimate masculine, gN = neuter, gF = feminine, gR = family/surname

### Number (n) - for nouns, adjectives, pronouns, numerals
nS = singular, nP = plural

### Case (c) - for nouns, adjectives, pronouns, numerals, prepositions
c1 = nominative, c2 = genitive, c3 = dative, c4 = accusative, c5 = vocative, c6 = locative, c7 = instrumental

### Person (p) - for pronouns, verbs
p1 = first person, p2 = second person, p3 = third person

### Aspect (a) - for verbs only
aP = perfect, aI = imperfect, aB = biaspectual

### Verb type (m) - for verbs only
mF = infinitive, mI = present indicative, mR = imperative, mA = past participle (active), mN = passive participle (n/t-participle), mS = present transgressive, mD = past transgressive, mB = future indicative

### Degree (d) - for adjectives, adverbs
d1 = positive, d2 = comparative, d3 = superlative

### Pronoun type (x) - for pronouns
xP = personal, xO = possessive, xD = demonstrative, xT = delimitative

### Pronoun subtype (y) - for pronouns
yF = reflexive, yQ = interrogative, yR = relative, yN = negative, yI = indeterminate

### Numeral type (x) - for numerals
xC = cardinal, xO = ordinal, xR = reproductive

### Numeral subtype (y) - for numerals
yN = negative, yI = indeterminate

### Adverb type (x) - for adverbs
xD = demonstrative, xT = delimitative

### Adverb subtype (y) - for adverbs
yQ = interrogative, yR = relative, yN = negative, yI = indeterminate

### Adverb semantic type (t) - for adverbs
tS = status, tD = modal, tT = time, tA = respect, tC = reason, tL = place, tM = manner, tQ = extent

### Conjunction type (x) - for conjunctions
xC = coordinate, xS = subordinate

### Stylistic flag (w) - for nouns, adjectives, pronouns, numerals, verbs, adverbs, prepositions, conjunctions, particles
wA = archaism, wB = poeticism, wC = only in corpora, wE = expressive, wH = conversational, wK = bookish, wN = dialectal, wO = regional, wR = rare, wZ = obsolete

### Punctuation type (x) - for punctuation
x. = .?!, x, = ,:;, x" = quotes, x( = opening brackets, x) = closing brackets, x~ = other symbols

### Noun special paradigm (x)
xP = special paradigm (půl, čtvrt)

### Additional semantic features
hT = represents thing, hP = represents person
preloaded/trends_en:
# English TreeTagger Corpus (Sketch Engine) - CQL Reference

## General Context

English corpus using TreeTagger tagset with Sketch Engine modifications (pipeline version 3). Based on Penn Treebank tagset with key differences: distinguishes be (VB*) and have (VH*) from other verbs (VV*); uses NP/NPS for proper nouns; possessive clitic ('s) re-tokenized and joined to preceding word creating possessive tags (*Z); indefinite "a/an" lemmatized as "a".

## How to Write CQL with This Tagset

**Tag format is strict:** Use `[tag="TAG"]` with straight double quotation marks only.

**Available positional attributes:**
- `word` - original word form
- `tag` - POS tag
- `lemma` - lemmatized form
- `pos` - part of speech
- `lempos` - lemma with POS suffix
- `lc` - lowercase word
- `lemma_lc` - lowercase lemma
- `lempos_lc` - lowercase lempos

**Structures:**
- `g`, `s` (sentence), `p` (paragraph with `heading` attribute)
- `doc` (document) with attributes: `url`, `title`, `urldomain`, `feed`, `website`, `tld`, `date`, `city`, `country`, `month`, `quarter`, `topic`, `year`, `genre`

**Lempos suffixes:** Append to lemma: `-j` (adjective), `-a` (adverb), `-c` (conjunction), `-n` (noun), `-i` (preposition), `-d` (pronoun), `-v` (verb)

**Regex patterns for POS categories:**
- Adjectives: `J.*`
- Adverbs: `RB.?`
- Nouns: `N.*`
- Pronouns: `PP.?`
- Verbs: `V.*`

**Word sketch relations available:** 70+ grammatical relations including subjects, objects, modifiers, predicates, phrasal verb particles, possessives, complements, prepositional phrases.

## The Tagset

**(empty tag)** - HTML/entities in angle brackets  
**" or "** - single/double quotation marks  
**(** - left brackets: ( [ {  
**)** - right brackets: ) ] }  
**,** - comma  
**$** - currency symbols: $ £ €  
**#** - hash/number sign  
**:** - dashes, ellipsis, underscore, colon, semicolon: - … .. _ ; :  
**CC** - coordinating conjunction (and, or, but)  
**CD** - cardinal number (1, one, two)  
**CDZ** - possessive numeral (one's)  
**DT** - determiner (the, a, an, this)  
**EX** - existential there (there is/are)  
**FW** - foreign word (d'hoevre)  
**IN** - preposition or subordinating conjunction (in, of, like, because)  
**IN/that** - "that" as subordinator  
**JJ** - adjective, base form (green, big)  
**JJR** - adjective, comparative (greener, bigger)  
**JJS** - adjective, superlative (greenest, biggest)  
**LS** - list marker (1), a.)  
**MD** - modal verb (could, will, should, would, can, must)  
**NN** - noun, singular or mass (table, water)  
**NNS** - noun, plural (tables, people)  
**NNSZ** - possessive noun plural (people's, women's, workers')  
**NNZ** - possessive noun singular (year's, world's, dog's)  
**NP** - proper noun, singular (John, London, Microsoft)  
**NPS** - proper noun, plural (Vikings, Americans)  
**NPSZ** - possessive proper noun plural (Boys', Workers')  
**NPZ** - possessive proper noun singular (Britain's, God's, John's)  
**PDT** - predeterminer (both, all, half in "both the boys")  
**PP** - personal pronoun (I, he, it, they, you)  
**PPZ** - possessive pronoun (my, his, their, your)  
**RB** - adverb, base form (however, usually, naturally, here, well)  
**RBR** - adverb, comparative (better, faster)  
**RBS** - adverb, superlative (best, fastest)  
**RP** - particle (up, off, on in phrasal verbs)  
**SENT** - sentence-break punctuation (. ! ?)  
**SYM** - symbols not listed above (/ = * + @)  
**TO** - infinitive marker "to" (to go, to be)  
**UH** - interjection (oh, uh, wow)  
**VB** - verb be, base form (be)  
**VBD** - verb be, past tense (was, were)  
**VBG** - verb be, gerund/present participle (being)  
**VBN** - verb be, past participle (been)  
**VBP** - verb be, present non-3rd person (am, are)  
**VBZ** - verb be, 3rd person singular present (is)  
**VH** - verb have, base form (have)  
**VHD** - verb have, past tense (had)  
**VHG** - verb have, gerund/present participle (having)  
**VHN** - verb have, past participle (had)  
**VHP** - verb have, present non-3rd person (have)  
**VHZ** - verb have, 3rd person singular present (has)  
**VV** - verb, base form (take, run, say)  
**VVD** - verb, past tense (took, ran, said)  
**VVG** - verb, gerund/present participle (taking, running, saying)  
**VVN** - verb, past participle (taken, run, said)  
**VVP** - verb, present non-3rd person (take, run, say)  
**VVZ** - verb, 3rd person singular present (takes, runs, says)  
**WDT** - wh-determiner (which, that, whatever)  
**WP** - wh-pronoun (who, what, whom)  
**WPZ** - possessive wh-pronoun (whose)  
**WRB** - wh-adverb (where, when, why, how)  
**Z** - possessive ending ('s when standalone)
preloaded/frtenten22_fl4:
# French FreeLing Corpus - CQL Reference

## General Context

**Language:** French  
**Tagger:** FreeLing morphological tagger (based on EAGLES standard)

**Available token-level attributes:**
- `word`, `tag`, `lemma`, `lempos`, `pos`, `shorttag`, `tags`, `lc`, `lemma_lc`, `lempos_lc`, `morphemes`, `gender_lemma`, `gender_guess`, `number_guess`

**Document structures:**
- `doc` with attributes: `url`, `title`, `wiki_categories`, `urldomain`, `website`, `crawl_date`, `modified_date`, `tld`, `wiki_translations`, `modified_month`, `modified_year`, `topic`, `domain_distance`, `genre`, `crawl_year`, `src`
- `p` (paragraph) with attributes: `heading`, `lang_diff`
- `s` (sentence), `g` (possibly grouping)

**Word sketch relations available:** subjects of "%w", objects of "%w", modifiers of "%w", adjectives after "%w", nouns modified by "%w", verbs with "%w" as object/subject, pronominal subjects/objects/possessors of "%w", infinitive objects of "%w", prepositional phrases, and modal constructions (pouvoir/devoir/aller/venir de/être en train de "%w"), plus comparison structures (more/less "%w" than), article constructions (with_definite_article, with_indefinite_article).

## How CQL with Tagset Should Be Written

**Tag format is STRICT and positional.** Use straight double quotation marks only.

**POS annotation shortcuts:** `A.*` (adjective), `R.*` (adverb), `C.*` (conjunction), `D.*` (determiner), `I.*` (interjection), `N.*` (noun), `Z.*` (numeral), `S.*` (preposition), `V.*` (verb), `P.*` (pronoun)

**Lempos suffixes:** Lemmas append: `-j` (adjective), `-r` (adverb), `-c` (conjunction), `-n` (noun), `-m` (numeral), `-i` (preposition), `-p` (pronoun), `-v` (verb)

**Examples:**
- `[tag="N.FS.*"]` = singular feminine nouns (e.g., vie, ligne)
- `[tag="V..I.*"]` = imperfective verbs
- `[lempos="vie-n"]` = noun "vie"

**Wildcard usage:** Use `.*` to match remaining positions when needed.

## The Tagset

### Positional Tags (format: position-based with dots separator)

**ADJECTIVE (A):**
0: Category = `A` (adjective)
1: Type = `O` (ordinal), `Q` (qualificative), `P` (possessive)
2: Degree = `S` (superlative), `V` (evaluative)
3: Gender = `F` (feminine), `M` (masculine), `C` (common)
4: Number = `S` (singular), `P` (plural), `N` (invariable)
5: Possessor person = `1`, `2`, `3`
6: Possessor number = `S` (singular), `P` (plural), `N` (invariable)

**NOUN (N):**
0: Category = `N` (noun)
1: Type = `C` (common), `P` (proper)
2: Gender = `F` (feminine), `M` (masculine), `C` (common), `N` (neuter)
3: Number = `S` (singular), `P` (plural), `N` (invariable)
4: Named entity class = `S` (person), `G` (location), `O` (organization), `V` (other)
5: Named entity subclass = (not used)
6: Degree = `A` (augmentative), `D` (diminutive)

**VERB (V):**
0: Category = `V` (verb)
1: Type = `M` (main), `A` (auxiliary), `S` (semiauxiliary)
2: Mood = `I` (indicative), `S` (subjunctive), `M` (imperative), `P` (participle), `G` (gerund), `N` (infinitive)
3: Tense = `P` (present), `I` (imperfect), `F` (future), `S` (past), `C` (conditional)
4: Person = `1`, `2`, `3`
5: Number = `S` (singular), `P` (plural)
6: Gender = `F` (feminine), `M` (masculine), `C` (common), `N` (neuter)

**PRONOUN (P):**
0: Category = `P` (pronoun)
1: Type = `D` (demonstrative), `E` (exclamative), `I` (indefinite), `T` (interrogative), `N` (numeral), `P` (personal), `X` (possessive), `R` (relative)
2: Person = `1`, `2`, `3`
3: Gender = `F` (feminine), `M` (masculine), `C` (common), `N` (neuter)
4: Number = `S` (singular), `P` (plural), `N` (invariable)
5: Case = `N` (nominative), `A` (accusative), `D` (dative), `O` (oblique)
6: Polite = `P` (yes)

**DETERMINER (D):**
0: Category = `D` (determiner)
1: Type = `A` (article), `D` (demonstrative), `E` (exclamative), `I` (indefinite), `T` (interrogative), `N` (numeral), `P` (possessive), `R` (relative)
2: Person = `1`, `2`, `3`
3: Gender = `F` (feminine), `M` (masculine), `C` (common), `N` (neuter)
4: Number = `S` (singular), `P` (plural), `N` (invariable)
5: Possessor number = `S` (singular), `P` (plural)

**ADVERB (R):**
0: Category = `R` (adverb)
1: Type = `N` (negative), `G` (general)

**ADPOSITION/PREPOSITION (S):**
0: Category = `S` (adposition)
1: Type = `P` (preposition)

**CONJUNCTION (C):**
0: Category = `C` (conjunction)
1: Type = `C` (coordinating), `S` (subordinating)

**NUMBER (Z):**
0: Category = `Z` (number)
1: Type = `d` (partitive), `m` (currency), `p` (percentage), `u` (unit)

**DATE (W):**
0: Category = `W` (date)

**INTERJECTION (I):**
0: Category = `I` (interjection)

### Non-Positional Tags (punctuation)

`Fd` (colon), `Fc` (comma), `Fp` (period), `Fx` (semicolon), `Fs` (etc), `Fg` (hyphen), `Fh` (slash), `Ft` (percentage), `Fe` (quotation generic), `Fra` (quotation open), `Frc` (quotation close), `Fpa` (parenthesis open), `Fpt` (parenthesis close), `Fca` (square bracket open), `Fct` (square bracket close), `Fla` (curly bracket open), `Flt` (curly bracket close), `Faa` (exclamation mark open), `Fat` (exclamation mark close), `Fia` (question mark open), `Fit` (question mark close), `Fz` (other punctuation)

# English Corpus - Penn Treebank Tagset (TreeTagger + Sketch Engine modifications)

## General Context

English corpus annotated with Penn Treebank tagset modified by TreeTagger and Sketch Engine. Contains spoken/written text with document, chapter, paragraph, sentence, and speaker structures.

**Available attributes:** word, tag, lempos, lemma, lemma_lc, lc

**Structures:**
- g (glue/token group)
- s (sentence, has id)
- p (paragraph, has id)
- speaker (has: name, id, language)
- chapter (has id)
- document (has: id, wordcount)

**Word sketch relations:** Extensive grammatical relations available including subject/subject_of, object/object_of, modifier/modifies, possessed/possessor, passive, predicate/predicate_of, adj_subject, adj_comp, infin_comp, ing_comp, reflexive, and/or, plus prepositional phrase relations (pp_PREP-i/pp_obj_PREP-i for each preposition), and phrasal verb patterns (part_PARTICLE-x/part_PARTICLE-x_obj).

## How CQL with Tagset Should Be Written

**Tag format is strict.** Each tag must match exactly as listed (case-sensitive). Use `[tag="TAG"]` syntax.

**Lempos format:** lemma + suffix. Suffixes are: -j (adjective), -a (adverb), -c (conjunction), -n (noun), -i (preposition), -p (pronoun), -v (verb). Use `[lempos="word-suffix"]`.

**Pattern shortcuts available via annotations:**
- J.* = adjectives, RB.? = adverbs, CC = conjunction, DT = determiner, N.* = nouns, CD = numeral, RP = particle, IN = preposition, PP.? = pronoun, V.* = verbs

**Key modification:** Word "to" is tagged IN when preposition, TO when infinitive marker.

## The Tagset

**Format:** Each tag is atomic (single unbreakable code). Use exact match.

**Verbs - BE (VB*):**
VB = base form (be)
VBD = past tense (was, were)
VBG = gerund/present participle (being)
VBN = past participle (been)
VBP = singular present, non-3rd person (am, are)
VBZ = 3rd person singular present (is)

**Verbs - HAVE (VH*):**
VH = base form (have)
VHD = past tense (had)
VHG = gerund/present participle (having)
VHN = past participle (had)
VHP = singular present, non-3rd person (have)
VHZ = 3rd person singular present (has)

**Verbs - OTHER (VV*):**
VV = base form (take)
VVD = past tense (took)
VVG = gerund/present participle (taking)
VVN = past participle (taken)
VVP = singular present, non-3rd person (take)
VVZ = 3rd person singular present (takes)

**Nouns:**
NN = singular or mass noun (table)
NNS = plural noun (tables)
NP = proper noun singular (John)
NPS = proper noun plural (Vikings)

**Adjectives:**
JJ = adjective (green)
JJR = comparative adjective (greener)
JJS = superlative adjective (greenest)

**Adverbs:**
RB = adverb (however, naturally)
RBR = comparative adverb (better)
RBS = superlative adverb (best)

**Pronouns:**
PP = personal pronoun (I, he, it)
PPZ = possessive pronoun (my, his)
WP = wh-pronoun (who, what)
WP$ = possessive wh-pronoun (whose)

**Determiners:**
DT = determiner (the)
PDT = predeterminer (both)
WDT = wh-determiner (which)

**Function words:**
CC = coordinating conjunction (and)
IN = preposition/subordinating conjunction (in, of, like)
IN/that = "that" as subordinator
TO = infinitive "to"
MD = modal (could, will)
RP = particle (up in "give up")

**Other:**
CD = cardinal number (1, third)
EX = existential "there" (there is)
FW = foreign word
LS = list marker (1))
POS = possessive ending ('s)
UH = interjection (uhh)
WRB = wh-adverb (where, when)

**Punctuation:**
SENT = sentence-break punctuation (. ! ?)
SYM = symbol (/ [ = *)
" = quotation marks (' ")
`` = opening quotation marks
( = opening brackets
) = closing brackets
, = comma
: = other punctuation (- ; : -- …)
# = hash
$ = dollar
